Text: The truth is our overall expenditures will continue to grow with an ageing population and we have to prepare for it. As a responsible and prudent Government, we must maintain a balanced budget and ensure that the Government's revenue can match the increasing social and health spending as our population ages.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: As Minister Heng mentioned in his speech, we may have to raise revenues through new taxes or raise tax rates in future to meet the rising domestic expenditure needs.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: On this front, I would like to talk about our stamp duties related to residential properties, which I believe there is room for us to be more progressive.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Buyers of residential properties are required to pay Buyer's Stamp Duty. There is also Additional Buyer's Stamp Duty, or ABSD, which was introduced in December 2011 and revised upwards in January 2013 to cool the residential market.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Sir, I have two suggestions for consideration. First, I would like to suggest replacing the ABSD with a tiered Buyer's Stamp Duty. I understand that the objective of ABSD is to moderate demand for residential properties, and to promote a stable and sustainable property market. Private residential prices in Singapore have slipped for 13th straight quarters and have fallen by 3% last year.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Because the ABSD scheme is seen as a cooling measure, it is viewed as a temporary measure which will be removed when the market has indeed softened. But we always run the risk that the property market may spike up when ABSD is removed.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Sir, to solve this conundrum, my suggestion is to remove the ABSD for Singapore citizens and add an additional tier to the Buyer's Stamp Duty. ABSD for non-citizens should remain but be adjusted to take into account the revised tiering of Buyer's Stamp Duty.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Allow me to explain. As it stands, the rates for Buyer's Stamp Duty is computed on the purchase price or market value of the property, whichever is higher. The Buyer's Stamp Duty rate for the first $180,000 is 1%, followed by 2% for the next $180,000. Stamp duty payable for amounts above $360,000 is 3%.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: I would like to suggest adding an additional tier of 10% for transaction value above $1 million. With the higher threshold of $1 million, I believe this will not significantly affect most middle income families and HDB upgraders. This would also be similar to having ABSD of 7% on top of the current Buyer's Stamp Duty of 3%. This change would also be seen as a permanent change to the stamp duties structure rather than the current ABSD scheme which is seen as a temporary scheme.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Sir, my second suggestion is for the Government to review its concept of ownership on residential properties which currently only applies to the registered owner but not the beneficial owner.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Currently, if a residential property is held under a special purpose vehicle, or SPV, and if the SPV is transferred from seller to buyer, normal residential stamp duty is not payable. This is because the registered owner of the residential property still remains as the SPV and does not change. I think this is an anomaly which needs to be addressed since for all intents and purposes the beneficial interest of the property has changed hands.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: In this type of situation, not only does the buyer of the SPV avoid paying Buyer's Stamp Duty and Additional Buyer's Stamp Duty, he also avoids paying Seller's Stamp Duty which would have been payable if the new buyer then flips out the underlying residential properties within the four-year period.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Most of the time, transactions of such nature are carried out by property developers and property investment companies, and this change is unlikely to affect individual buyers and sellers of residential properties.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Moreover, the nature of such stamp duties is that they are discretionary in nature as buyers and sellers already know the stamp duties payable beforehand and would have a choice of whether to enter into the property transaction.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: I hope that with these additional revenue sources, we will not need to increase other taxes which may impact low- to middle income families.

MP_Name: Mr Yee Chia Hsing (Chua Chu Kang)
Text: Sir, in conclusion, the initiatives for Budget 2017 are balanced and forward-looking, but we need to see how we can meet the fiscal challenges ahead while minimising the tax burden on the man in the street. Mr Deputy Speaker, Sir, I support the Budget.
